title: Top Drugs Final Mock D — 88 Questions

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits calcium influx into vascular and cardiac muscle; reduces heart rate and contractility.

choices: Competes with aldosterone in distal tubules; increases Na⁺/H₂O excretion while conserving K⁺
Inhibits conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II
answer: Competes with aldosterone in distal tubules; increases Na⁺/H₂O excretion while conserving K⁺

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits PCSK9, preventing LDL receptor degradation and increasing LDL clearance.

choices: Inhibits PCSK9 synthesis via RNA interference, increasing LDL receptor availability
Inhibits cholesterol absorption at the brush border of the small intestine
Activates PPAR-alpha to increase lipolysis of triglyceride-rich particles
Inhibits lipolysis in adipose tissue and reduces hepatic VLDL synthesis
answer: Inhibits PCSK9 synthesis via RNA interference, increasing LDL receptor availability

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Enhances antithrombin III; preferential inhibition of Factor Xa.

choices: Directly inhibits Factor Xa, preventing conversion of prothrombin to thrombin
Inhibits synthesis of vitamin K–dependent clotting factors II, VII, IX, and X
Enhances antithrombin III, inhibiting thrombin and Factor Xa
answer: Directly inhibits Factor Xa, preventing conversion of prothrombin to thrombin

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits potassium channels; prolongs action potential and refractory period of cardiac cells.

choices: Inhibits potassium channels responsible for repolarization; prolongs action potential and refractory period
Blocks sodium channels; decreases conduction in ischemic tissue
Slows AV nodal conduction via increased parasympathetic tone
answer: Inhibits potassium channels responsible for repolarization; prolongs action potential and refractory period

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production.
Pick the mechanism for Novolog (Insulin Aspart).
choices: Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production
Decreases hepatic glucose production and intestinal absorption of glucose
Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules, reducing glucose reabsorption
answer: Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Increases insulin sensitivity by activating PPAR-gamma.

choices: Activates GLP-1 receptor; increases glucose-dependent insulin; decreases inappropriate glucagon; slows gastric emptying; lowers food intake
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Activates GLP-1 receptor; increases glucose-dependent insulin; decreases inappropriate glucagon; slows gastric emptying; lowers food intake

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules, reducing glucose reabsorption.
Pick the mechanism for Glucotrol XL (Glipizide ER).
choices: Stimulates pancreatic beta cells by blocking ATP-sensitive potassium channels to increase insulin release
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Stimulates pancreatic beta cells by blocking ATP-sensitive potassium channels to increase insulin release

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Modulates activity of voltage-gated calcium channels by binding to the alpha-2-delta subunit; indirectly influences GABAergic activity.

choices: Inhibits voltage-dependent N-type calcium channels; facilitates GABAergic inhibition; binds synaptic proteins to modulate neurotransmitter release
Enhances GABA via benzodiazepine receptor complex
Stabilizes neuronal membranes and modulates release of excitatory neurotransmitters
Blocks voltage-dependent sodium channels; enhances GABA(A); antagonizes AMPA/kainate; weak carbonic anhydrase inhibitor
answer: Inhibits voltage-dependent N-type calcium channels; facilitates GABAergic inhibition; binds synaptic proteins to modulate neurotransmitter release

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Increases dopamine release by blocking alpha-2-adrenergic and 5-HT2C receptors.
Pick the mechanism for Effexor XR (Venlafaxine).
choices: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, increasing their levels
Selectively inhibits serotonin reuptake, increasing serotonin levels
Inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine and dopamine
answer: Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, increasing their levels

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2 receptors, producing antipsychotic effects.

choices: Partial agonist at dopamine D2 and 5-HT1A; antagonist at 5-HT2A receptors
Typical antipsychotic mechanism emphasis on class
Blocks sodium channels in ischemic tissue
answer: Partial agonist at dopamine D2 and 5-HT1A; antagonist at 5-HT2A receptors

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors; does not affect benzodiazepine-GABA receptors.

choices: Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex
Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A/5-HT2; no benzodiazepine receptor effect
Enhances GABA via non-benzodiazepine receptor complex
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex
